Welcome to Aurora’s documentation!¶

Aurora python

Aiding brazilian civil engineers to build reinforced concrete buildings

Author: Arthur Pendragon De Simone

class model.Footing.ShallowFooting(A, B, a, b, z, h0, h, x, y)[source]¶

Class to define a shallow footing

Initializer

Parameters

  • A (float) – The bottom measure in the y-direction

  • B (float) – The bottom measure in the x-direction

  • a (float) – The top measure in the y-direction

  • b (float) – The top measure in the x-direction

  • z (float) – The bottom of the shallow foundation

  • h0 (float) – The height of the flat part

  • h (float) – The total height

class view.App.App[source]¶

Class to encapsulate the app and maximize window on Windows environment

Opens a window, sets up a 3-D and several 2-D scene graphs, and everything else needed to render the scene graph to the window.

To prevent a window from being opened, set windowType to the string ‘none’ (or ‘offscreen’ to create an offscreen buffer). If this is not specified, the default value is taken from the ‘window-type’ configuration variable.

This constructor will add various things to the Python builtins scope, including this instance itself (under the name base).

base¶

To enable the camera

class view.Distance.Distance(showbase, UCS)[source]¶

Class to calculate the distance between the cursor and a plane initially set to zero height (z=0)

get_mouse_pos(task)[source]¶

Method to calculate the intersection between the camera point and a plane specified. Also responsible for placing the UCS cursor following the mouse

view.Geometry.makeCube(x1, y1, z1, x2, y2, z2, render, color_face=LVecBase4f(1, 1, 1, 1), edge_thickness=3)[source]¶

Method to draw a hollow cube

Parameters

  • x1 (float) – the first lower left x coordinate

  • y1 (float) – the first lower left y coordinate

  • z1 (float) – the first lower left z coordinate

  • x2 (float) – the first upper left x coordinate

  • y2 (float) – the first upper left y coordinate

  • z2 (float) – the first upper left z coordinate

  • color_square (:class:'panda.core.LVecBase4f') – the cube’s color in RGBA vector form

class view.Grid.Grid(showbase)[source]¶

Class to draw a simple grid in the scene, this class also has a method to draw a plane to serve as reference to drawing

Constructor method

draw_grid(lines=100, spacing=1.0, thickness=1, color=(0.1, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1), z_shift=0.05)[source]¶

Method to draw a simple finite grid in the scene

Parameters

  • lines (int) – Number of lines

  • spacing (float) – Grid spacing=1

  • thickness (int) – Line’s thickness

  • color (tuple) – Line’s color

  • z_shift (float) – Displacement of grid in relation to xy plane

draw_plane(a=(0, 0), b=(100, 100), color=(0.15, 0.15, 0.15, 1))[source]¶

Method to draw a plane using panda3d.core.CardMaker

Parameters

  • a (tuple) – The card’s initial point

  • b (tuple) – The card’s final point

  • color (tuple) – The card’s color

This snippet shows how to create a tooltip text that will be attached to the cursor and check it’s position to not move out of the screen.
